intro: Gaultheria vestita, commonly known as the velvetleaf wintergreen, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants such as blueberries and heathers. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. Its berries, which are typically red or orange, are edible and contain a high concentration of aromatic oils. Gaultheria vestita is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
